import React, { useState } from 'react'; //AKA the navbar, holds all the tools, settings, and whatnot on the top of the page function ToolsBar(props) { const [content, setContent] = useState(null); const handleClick = (e) => { console.log(e.target.id); setContent(e.target.id); if (props.toggle && props.toggle===e.target.id) { //if user toggles tool that is already active, deactivate tool props.setToggle(null); } else { //otherwise, activate tool props.setToggle(e.target.id); } e.preventDefault(); } return ( <>
